38148794.review: "C"  Free experience so it's a question of value for time.  Short easy and interesting, my main issue was with stability. 38083483.review:
[h1]Played On: [b]HTC Vive[/b][/h1]

In The Price of Freedom, step into the shoes of a government hitman who has been issued one task: assassinate the traitor, Benjamin Miller. Taking place in the 1960's, the United States is at the height of the Cold War with Russia, and the looming threat of nuclear war pervades the atmosphere. Miller has stolen top secret chemical weapons research files from the CIA, and it's up to you to recover the documents before they land in the wrong hands. However, there's more to this story than meets the eye.

To say that this title is unlike any other experience in VR right now is a total understatement. There are truly not enough positive things that could be said about the game, from its government brainwashing beginning where you swallow pills to choose which language that the audio plays out in, to the very climactic ending that'll leave you desparately wanting more. Much of the gameplay goes slightly in depth on conspiracy theories and known United States government testing, such as the infamous MK Ultra experiments. There are quite a few documents that can be picked up and read, and though the puzzles that lay in wait are simple, they're still compelling in their own way. Even the ending will have you running through the game once more to see if there's an alternate path that can be made.

The graphics and controls are top notch, everything looks crisp and has a tight handle. I was able to get through the whole game without any issue in my 2mx2m room-scale set up, so not a lot of space is necessary to give The Price of Freedom a whirl. It's definitely one of the greatest and most unique free games on the market right now, and I would gladly pay for a full, polished product of this nature. Detailed spy games are in short supply, and the half hour spent with The Price of Freedom is simply not enough.

[h1]Rating: [b]5.0/5.0[/b] - An astonishing achievement, this game must be played.[/h1]
The Virtual Reality Network [url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/31311814/]Curator[/url] | [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/thevirtualrealitynetwork]Group[/url] Click for More

This is a really nice story.  Most escape room/puzzle type games just don't have this much story or reason to go forward.  Here the destination is definitely worth getting to.  The puzzles are kind of easy, but that's okay because the narrative is really interesting and the production values are high.  All these things put together really make you feel like you are a spy involved in a super secret mission that's maybe on the shady side.

35457796.review:
Recommending that you try the game for yourself as it was a good experience in particular if you do not end up having the issues detailed below. As it is at the moment of testing I am leaving a [Negative] as a constructive feedback and will adjust the review if most of the issues mentioned below are addressed in the future.

This might have to do with the fact that it was designed for the HTC Vive but the first thing I noticed was the initial orientation of the room which wasn’t facing the camera and rather taking place in a 90 degree orientation.
This wouldn't have been much of a problem if things didn’t get worse once in the room with the flashlight where the action was taking place behind the user so the sensors were blocked and couldn’t track properly – there should be a way to reorient the camera with the game (it changes multiple times across the experience). As a side note a third sensor might have helped but that is beside the point I am making here with the orientation of the camera and the impeded movements. Being that the majority of relevant interaction is done in that room, most of the experience was impacted.

Next, the idea of the UV lamp worked wonders however here came the second issue I experienced: I dropped the flashlight a few times on the table to accomplish other manipulations and a few times it dropped on the floor – well after the third time or so the flashlight seems to have vanished and I had to restart the whole thing. I did not try to break the game on my second and final attempt so I don’t know if this behavior can occur repeatedly or not. 

But the major issue encountered was actually the presence of visual glitches where the whole screen would turn gray (this is known to happen in Google Earth in particular) depending on what you are looking at. This behavior constantly happened when in the room with the flashlight near the red candles where you happen to read stuff in particular and also happened at the credits around the last highlighted footprint.

While this experience was free and the rest of the experience was satisfying including the story elements considering the length of the experience, each of these issues broke the immersion and wouldn’t be acceptable in a retail product.

I hope we will see more of these as the premise was interesting and could lead to a lot of places!

Edit: Typo and formulation.

As a fan of point-and-click adventures, this baby was right up my alley, albeit a bit easy. But that didn't matter because being inside this world was gloriously atmospheric and fun. 
 
Note: I recommend turning your chaperone as low as you can go, you won't really need it and it will just break immersion. I just had the developer setting on my Vive which would show the floor lines on the lightest setting (least opaque) it had.  

To it's credit, I am very much looking forward to any continuation of this and would shell out moolah for it.  
Spoiler for those who have played already: [spoiler] I've never wanted to put on a dress till I played this game![/spoiler]
It's very linear, but as a narrative AND as a short intro to a series, it wouldn't make sense to do it another way.  
Enjoy! This is the kind of stuff one wants in VR.

30496412.review:
Definitely a great experience for free.
It only took me 17 minutes to beat (and that includes reading all the notes and listening to all the tapes, etc), but it was a high quality experience, that is totally justified given it is free.

This game is a historic fiction, taking place surrounding real events regarding Cold War-era CIA testing LSD as a mind control serum, but the specific anecdote is fictional. 

There is very little in terms of actual gameplay, but the story is robust. You're sent to controversially assasinate an investigative journalist, but besides that there's virtually nothing I could say without spoiling it. 

It's a solid and wholesome story-driven experience, I'd definitely recommend downloading it.

30455334.review: 8.5/10 - Very simple experience with an incredible story.  Makes fantastic use of the medium—VR.

30399173.review: 中文版已支持！ 更能了解故事的全部经过了！

30378070.review:
One complaint: the gameplay was a bit clunky. I would advise the developers to put a little bit more time into placing their triggers in such a way that the user can grab something quickly and easily, rather than having to grope around until the tactile response indicates that they've put their hands in the right spot. On first playthrough, I would guess the triggers need to extend further towards/past the fingertips. The orientation of the hands isn't quite right either, and holding something such that you can read it is more than a little awkward. I also would advise making it a little more obvious that the first door is locked. In future episodes, I would also like to see a more polished locomotion system. The blackouts between locations are immersion breaking.

Essentially, it's clear the effort here was put towards the story. Game mechanics feel like an afterthought, a boring distraction cobbled together quickly in order to move on to more interesting things, and the result is a game that feels like a very pretty prototype. The narrative is excellent, but the mechanics get in the way. I would love to see that addressed in future updates/episodes.

Otherwise, this is an excellent experience, and I would strongly recommend it as a quick introduction to what VR can do in the storytelling arena. I look forward to future episodes, and would gladly be willing to pay for such episodes provided they were of a suitable length.

30363621.review:
[b]The Price of Freedom[/b] is a short, story-oriented room-scale VR experience.

The player assumes the role of Agent Zero, joining the game at the start of briefing sequence reminiscent of a Cold War spy thriller. Once the stage has been set and your orders have been issued, your mission immediately begins. Most of the gameplay involves exploration, investigation, and infiltration. There are a few simple puzzles, but the experience is mainly narrative in nature.

The game takes place in a sequence of small rooms - only room space locomotion is needed.

The area the game encompasses isn't large, but it's fairly detail-rich, allowing you to snoop through documents, peruse photographs, etc. It takes 20-30 minutes to complete.

[spoiler]I found it thought-provoking, particularly in terms of what kinds of actions people readily undertake in video games, on the flimsiest of pretexts, and how it could feel if that kind of mindless, programmed violence were translated to our everyday lives.[/spoiler]

Whatever the price of freedom, the price of The Price of Freedom is currently 0, and it's certainly worth a try.

29526197.review:
Of all the VR games I have played so far, this was the most immersive, as I even forgot for a moment that there was no table and "dropped" my controller on the floor as I needed to do something outside the game. Then for several minutes, I felt very strange holding on objects. I am very surprised since I have played quite a few VR games and experiences and have not "lost" my sense of the real world. I don't know if I should be happy or concerned :)

The puzzles were just right, not too hard and quite logical, so hopfeully the game desgners will not decide that they need to make puzzles so hard that only through collaborative cheating one can solve them (as most games with puzzles seem to do - I am getting way too old for those games).

Certainly looking forward to the release of this game.
Thanks.

29113380.review: Это нихуя так коротко, это ахуенно и это бесплатно

29100314.review:
Again, one of those very short experience with VR.
You can see that as a very immersive Escape Room where the story is a capital aspect of the game.
20 minutes of games, non replayable, that makes it a VERY short experience indeed.
But the twist of the story is worth spending that time, definitevely. I had a bit the "Woaw" effect when it happened. Probably because I was expecting a standard double game or mole scenario.

When the game started, I was already thinking about giving a negative review because there are a lot of tiny mistake or things I simply don't like such as
- strange lights / glows which made me sometimes think there was a bug or something I didn't understand
- the way you pick items is definitevely not the standard way in VR. The item will warp suddently in your hand to its unique anchor point which also means that, if you drop an item reversed and pick it again, it suddently flips back. Very annoying.
- Two hands, but not useable at the same time... books will open themselves.
- some textures misplaced, probably due to putting depth on textures

Otherwise, the game is a great narrative experience and the audio is quite cool too.
Some very neat ideas similar to Excape Rooms that work very well in VR.

To conclude, not technicaly perfect and sometimes awkward, but great sense of story telling and VR experience.

29095489.review:
Exellent use of the 2m x 1.5m smallest roomscale setup! Completely avoiding motion sickness and teleporting etc.

I had some minor problems, that has also been mentioned by other players, about the hand position.
It feels strange because the ingame hands are about 5-10centimeters in front of your real hands, and the angle is different.
This makes pushing buttons and picking up items more difficult than it should be.

If this is fixed, this game is pretty much perfect. The game would also double as good example to show people who have never tried VR, what it is all about.

29095488.review: Very nice game but a little bit short !!

29065265.review:
I must say this is an amazing experience!
Not only it is free but it is also an immersive short game that turns upside down and had my feelings rage!
I wanna say that if a game is good i remember it after i play it and this one is one of those games and there are not a lot of experiences on the vive that make me remember them after i finished them.
Great job devs you should be proud of this experience.


"The Price Of Freedom"!

29063451.review:
What a great, beautifull mini-game. 
The story is about as good as it gets, starts out very basic, but the story goes so deep and is actually the best experience I ever had on the HTC vive. 
This was phenomenal, thank you devs for bringing this experience to VR, I really appreciate this alot. 

Goes without saying, if you own the vive, you have to play this.

29056640.review:
Only about 15 minutes of playable content, but this is an incredibly promising showcase of what's possible with VR storytelling. Despite some classic VR issues (hands not properly aligned with controller, some jerky transitions) this was an extremely immersive experience, owing in part to excellent sound design, more than acceptable graphics, and truly excellent  storytelling. 

Looking forward to future episodes, and really any more story-driven content from Construct. I'd buy a longer experience like this in a heartbeat.

29045522.review: Very, very cool, interactive thriller. Good story, interactions work well but its not a puzzle game, just an interactive story.And it's free!

29041066.review:
Short but well crafted experience.

29030492.review:

29024685.review: Amazing game! It's a short experience but still awesome

29021555.review:
A very good short criminal story with emotions. I liked it a lot and can only recommend to test it for yourself as it is also free.

It shows perfectly fine what VR is capable when it comes to story telling. You feel immediately immersed in the environments. Reading through files in VR is so much better than just reading them on a normal screen. Even little puzzle that would normally bore you make fun in VR with motion controllers.

One minor critic is the way how the hands are situated compared to the controller. This does not feel naturally and even hurts a bit if you try to hold a file straight in order to read it. This could be fixed actually. Also the gun has the same problem that it does not feel like you are holding it naturally.

Recommended. Good work. I am looking forward to another episode or new short story.

[i] Twitch Channel : https://www.twitch.tv/mrorange55
Youtube Channel : https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC1UE5TPoF0HX0HVpF_E4uPQ/videos?view_as=subscriber [/i]

29020363.review: Если вы нищая бомжара без шлема виртуальной реальности то эта игра вам не подходит.

29018024.review: Interesting story. It was short, but worth playing considering it was free. My only complaint is that I think some items can only be used with your right hand, which sucks because im left-handed

29012106.review: Awesome game! It was very good excperience!

29010218.review: Short but good VR experience. Well worth the time.

28996699.review:
My first impression of the experence is that I really enjoyed it! If good VR storytelling is what you're craving, check this out. 

It's not very long but the time spent in it is worthwhile, so I wouldn't call that con. The only thing I will warn about is the various rooms feel a little off in a way I can't put my finger on. This caused a slight bit of discomfort, but again not enough to not be an issue. 

This is clearly a test of the creators story telling ablity.  Keep it up, you're going to make great things.

28989400.review:
It's free, it's short and it's great.

I only downloaded The Price of Freedom because it was free. I had no idea what I was getting myself into. After a rather straightforward but fun intro, the story takes a turn to reveal something that sohws it is much more than just some run-of-the-mill free VR game. I won't spoil it for those of you who haven't played it, but the story gets to some pretty creepy, screwed up and shocking places.

Ultimately it's only a taster as to what is to come, but already I'm dying to see what comes next, and I'm willing to pay for it if it lives up to this prologue. My only concern is that the next episode maintains the momentum of this one. Personally what I'm hoping for in episode one is:

-Bigger play areas
-Longer levels
-ability to move/teleport around the environment
-ability to interact with characters
-continuation of the classic spy feel

Ultimately, The Price of Freedom sets the stage for something that could be truly great. Whether the devs create a game that lives up to this prologue remains to be seen, but this is one of my favourite VR experiences to date.

Great job!!

28984703.review:
This game is worth your time. It's very short, about 15 minutes or so, but it tells a really cool story. It's not the most mind blowing VR experience I've had, but because it was one of the first one I tried, it did blow my mind at the time. If I had not tried it firrst, and had experienced a bunch of other VR titles before it, I don't think it would have been anything really special in terms of graphical or environmental experience, but the story still would have been. 

For free, this game is worth it. I think the developers are really onto something here, and I can see a full game coming out of something like this.

28982790.review:
Echt genial, es kommt alles so real rüber. Selbst wenn Episode 1 sehr kurz ist, war ich schwer fasziniert und freue mich auf den Rest.
Great job, guys!!!

28980001.review:
具有互动、剧情完整的探索类剧情反转悬疑小故事。游戏时长20分钟左右。
（在下英语听力六级水平，感觉足够了。

玩家扮演特工0号，根据听到的指令行事。玩家第一个任务——杀死一位名叫本杰明米勒的叛国者。轻松完成任务之后需要回收这名叛国者偷盗的一份文件[spoiler]，未曾想，通过文件，玩家发现自己竟然是本杰明的女儿，并且就是本杰明一直以来想要从行为控制计划中营救的对象。明知道自己被从大脑层面控制了行为，可是玩家还是无法拒绝发送指令的人传来的销毁文件的命令。[/spoiler]

游戏想传达一种无法抗拒命令的绝望，虽然玩家感受到的不是那么深刻，但是作为一个只有20分钟的小游戏，能够带来这样反转的剧情已经非常有意思了。非常值得体验一下。

28968117.review: I love this content, very immersive story

28960003.review: build the full game, her indoors loves it and would buy all day

28957993.review:
A short story movie game, the twist didn't hit me like I think the devs hoped it would. I don't want to name what video game series it reminded me of as that'd be a clear spolier, but let's just say it's not outside of the storytelling seen in major AAA Video Games. Nevertheless this game is very well presented and always interesting.

I am very excited to see what they produce next. As VR keeps improving it will be exciting to see how Adventure Games react to this technology. To actually be inside a story is such a stark difference from sitting down.

28898947.review: What a unique experience because it was more intimate than any other VR game ive played.  I really loved it.  I want more of this type of game.  Like living out a mystery novel while solving puzzles, and tugging at my emotions.

28876771.review:
Interesting use of VR. Story about real CIA experiment with human abuse and high crimes in the government is propably another fine way to educate people of what actually did hapen to propably hundreds of people using electroshocks combined with use of LSD and audiotapes to reprogram people to assasins. I've found it relevant that somebody called this science fiction (in reviews) but this actually is open secred ended in congressional investigation hearings. 
Wasn't sure to play this because of deep theme but it was interesting anyway. I think there would be great to have apps that educate people about not much known reality of history or current events. Or also for brainwash people with more smashing way :) I hope not the latter thing but the potencial is there.
There could be nice story about Roswell crash landings and similar ,] Btw check Paul Hellyer eg., ex minister of defence of Canada. He talks openly of similar stuff to media etc.

28694517.review:
更多VR游戏评测尽在83830.com

《自由代价》是一款冒险解谜游戏。游戏故事基于MKULTRA计划(人脑控制项目)真实事件改编，玩家在游戏中扮演一名被控制的特工，执行任务后发现事情真相。

游戏的表现手法非常独特，剧情通过旧时代黑白的真人演绎的视频来展现，游戏的解谜元素并不难，玩家通过场景搜索就可以破解谜题。游戏的剧情才是关键，将MKULTRA计划(人脑控制项目)事件揭露出来，而故事的最后也令人难以忘怀，不禁感慨这个恐怖计划的残忍。

游戏免费上架steam，如果对该事件感兴趣的玩家可以下载试玩。

28693225.review: If this is how a novella style vr can be played...I am in 100%..This is truly a gem for atmosphere...playability...and really pleasant voice overs..I am certain I will be a repeat customer if this get published in a series and they maintain the story with integrity....

28687643.review: This type of game is very suitable for VR. Impressive storytelling and narrative. There are puzzles, but solving them was too easy in my opinion. Maybe it's done on purpose to not allow poeple to get stuck in this demo. This game really made me excited for more.

28537790.review: Since it's free I won't give it a bad rating for how short this is. I feel like if it was longer, the plot twist would've had a bigger impact. I'd also love it a little more if the puzzles were a little harder. I rushed through the entire game and it actually felt like I was being handed the key that lead to the next part of the game. Funny thing is, I downloaded this game because I thought I would get to be a badass agent that kills traitors for my country but what I actually got was better. But just when it got good, it ended. Overall great story, great setting, just not enough time to soak it all up. 7/10
